Introducing Strong Foundations for Achieving Civic Leadership, a practical guide to civic-leadership achievement

The more people I serve, the more I see just how limiting self doubt can be. It amazes me how much the need for acceptance and belonging drives us to place extraordinary value on external relationships, material things, and arbitrary notions of success … at the expense of self acceptance and personal achievement.

Just like you, people who choose to build something great are concerned with being rejected, battle uncertainty, and struggle with vulnerability. The difference is that builders don’t allow their irrational emotions to prevent them from creating, generating value, and goal achievement. Of course you run the risk of creating something that fulfills your personal mission and having it judged negatively or not accepted by your stakeholders. But, if you don’t share your life’s mission, then you’ll commit a far worse crime.

Failing at something doesn’t make you a failure, it simply labels the action you took a mistake. Don’t blame yourself. See the action as a learning opportunity and take responsibility for your actions objectively.

Valley Leadership Institute, Class Member, Cohort 38

Valley Leadership is a leadership laboratory where theory meets reality. By drawing from the expertise of the State’s most respected and influential business, civic and community leaders, we provide real-time realities surrounding the most important issues shaping our community today, and in the future. In 2016, about 40 class members are selected for the nine-month program. Valley Leadership curates each Leadership Institute cohort through a robust selection and matching process that builds a diverse group primed to deepen their passions and advance their pursuits.

summary: An experienced sales executive with extensive U.S and international experience within the high tech industry. Proven strengths in developing and leading teams in the accomplishment of business goals and objectives, particularly in high growth environments. Ability to focus on business goals in periods of substantial transition, leading to results exceeding goals and expectation. My career has included living  at a combination of sales and management positions at large multi-nationals (GE, IBM, Cisco, Pitney Bowes), as well as executive positions at 3 technology startups in the US. These roles have meant living and working in London, Tokyo, Singapore, NY area, and now Arizona. Strong focus on team success and development through coaching and mentoring. MBA in International Management, completed in Singapore.  Areas of expertise:* Leadership and Management* Goal Setting and Goal Getting* Consultative Selling* Negotiations* Strategic Planning* Relationship Building* Coaching and DevelopmentSpecialties: Sales Management, VP Sales, Consultative Selling, team development, Exceeding the Target.
